column5: I was wondering if any Manitobans would like to direct me to some Walleye infested fishing holes? I just moved to Winnipeg 6 months ago and was thinking on hauling my boat here from Ontario. I also would like to know a good place to buy maps. Thank you

You can give the Red river a try Catfish right now even though its slow fishing at the moment, and come fall time you can get into some big Greenbacks on the Red. Great carp fishing to be had also. Manitoba is full of lakes to fish head north also to get into some great action. Head to Lockport for the Catfishing right now if your into that. NMhttp://www.xtremesportfishing.com/forum
lake of the prairies cedar lake lake of the woods (ontario) lac du bonnet maps at www.canadamapsales.com manitoba .... a 100,000 lakes how many walleyes ???? i will never have enough time....
The Winnipeg River system has awesome fishing opportunities.
Dauphin river and Grand rapids when the fish are running are both awsome spots.
hey, you should check out two other message boardswww.looneybeaver.com/forum and http://www.s10.invisionfree.com/thefishinglodge Where abouts in ontario are you coming from?

Thank you all for your help, that will give me a good start. I come from Dryden Ontario rivereye. I frequently fished the Wabigoon chain lakes(Dinorwic, Rock, Wabigoon), Minnitaki Lake, and Lac Seul(Williams Bay and Sioux Lookout area). I am a mainly a walleye hunter and have not fished a great deal for other species. Thank you for the other links, I will be sure to check them out. If any one else has any suggestions please feel free to reply. Thank you all.
